pros:
Little to no office politics
Work-life balance
Academic holidays
Management is accessible and friendly
cons:
High deductible health insurance
Pay is at the low end of the scale
Little room for raises or upward advancement, depending on role

pros: Department staff very professional and easy to work with.
cons: Expected to teach 15 hours (some of those grad courses) for base pay. No extra given for mileage or field work. 10 hours of office hours a week, committee work, accreditation work, book studies, weekly chapel, snd other events for no extra pay.

pros: Friendly, place to work in a great environment.
cons: Low pay. Benefits are not reasonable.

pros: Faculty are generally wonderful people who love teaching and care about students. The faculty generally get along great together and love teaching.
cons: Lots of administration issues, e.g. micromanagement, vindictiveness, overloading without pay, etc. Faculty are generally treated like children. Little support for academic pursuits among the faculty. Maintenance is a constant issue. Buildings are old and dilapidated; many are disheveled due to poor cleaning staff. Students are recruited from an extremely narrow demographic. The focus is on numbers rather than quality, which necessarily lowers the standards of acceptance and retention in every department. The administration so over-spiritualizes everything that any criticism or hardship is seen as an attacking from Satan rather than a result of their own incompetence (of course, it could be both). Additionally, there were breaches of contract and many reports of not paying overloads.

pros: Travel, meeting students, giving tours to prospective families
cons: Management is resistant to change or innovation, maintain status-quo, senior level management promised raises but there were no bonuses or raises in my 3 years there, high turnover rate in admissions counselors, pressured to increase numbers with little incentive, most students had to use student loans

pros: This place is full of good people who mean well and are working hard to improve the college. Students are from an excellent demographic.
cons: The upper management has a lot of institutional issues to iron out such as displaying transparency, rewarding excellence, keeping everyone accountable.

job_title: IT Helpdesk Specialist in Pineville, LA
pros: The long holidays (trust me, you need them).
cons: Unlivable wages, Bad bosses. More responsibilities put upon you with absolutely no incentives. Everyone throughs you under the bus.

review_title: Great people. Just a few institutional processes to iron out.
pros: Great work-life balance. Flexible people. Courteous student body.
cons: Lack of institutional effectiveness. Too many exceptions to the rules mark the procedures irrelevant to budget and goals.
